result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D McMillan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Expunction is conditionally granted ON COUNT 1 ONLY, upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 1.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on Count 1.   Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Mukwonago Police Dept.
With Huber. Release for standard conditions. LAST 15 days are Stayed.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 06/22/16 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.

Comply with Day Report Center for 30 Days. Good time not allowed on DRC. If defendant successfully completes DRC, the 15 days of Stayed Huber will be permanently Stayed.
Consecutive to: Huber Sentence

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
from Cornerstone Counseling dated 1/4/16

Defendant Joshua D McMillan in court with Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 3.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Scheidegger makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  6 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

 Expunction is conditionally granted ON COUNT #1 upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.


COUNT #3:  HUBER:  HUBER:  30 days, LAST 15 DAYS STAYED.  Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 8:00 a.m. on 3/8/16 

DAY REPORT CENTER:  30 DAYS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 15 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 

FINE: $1,179.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation on Count #1)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Village of Mukwonago Police Department (to be paid as a condition of probation on Count #1) 

DL REVOCATION: 14 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 14 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  6/22/16. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH
